meanings.definition: The state or fact of being able to dissociate or separate mentally or emotionally.
meanings.sent1: Her dissociabilities allowed her to detach from stressful situations easily.
meanings.sent2: The therapist discussed the patient's dissociabilities during the session.
meanings.sent3: His dissociabilities were so strong that he could switch off his emotions at will.
meanings.sent4: The actress's dissociabilities on stage were like a magician's disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's dissociabilities made him seem invincible in the face of danger.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being capable of being dissociated or separated.
meanings.sent1: The chemical's dissociabilities made it easy to break down into its components.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the dissociabilities of the new material in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The toy's dissociabilities allowed it to be taken apart and put back together.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting depicted the dissociabilities of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle's dissociabilities made it challenging yet fun to solve.
